rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A study of the field stress distribution around an elliptic hole under different loading conditions.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Mining Engineering and Applied Geophysics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: When a hole is made underground, stress redistribution occurs in its vicinity. The resulting concentration of stress is highest at the boundary and approaches unity as distance from the hole increases. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mining Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The interracial marriage in a Canadian Japanese community.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This research project was an exploratory descriptive study of the problems in marriage of fifteen Japanese-non-Japanese couples in the Greater Montreal community. It sought to determine the extent of problems perceived by the couples in specific areas, designated by theorists as problematic. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Building the alternative road to higher education in England.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The student of English technical education, reviewing the history of its development over the past hundred years, is tempted to conjecture how English education, particularly techincal education, would have developed if the Prince Consort had lived to exert the same unobtrusive influence during the later as he did during the earlier Victorian period. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Education.
Technical education -- Great Britain.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Programmed instruction with teacher participation : an experiment in teaching fractions to children who reside in the northwest Territories.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The schools of the Northwest Territories are administered by the Education Division of the Department of Northern Affairs and National Resources which is interested in the possible value of programmed instruction of pupils in the schools in the far north. There have been many instances of studies comparing groups of students taught by programmed instruction and groups of students taught by conventional methods. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Arithmetic -- Study and teaching.
Education.
Programmed instruction.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Law and space telecommunications.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Institute of Air and Space Law
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Despite its importance, and the length of the annexed bibliography, Telecommunications is a topic which has been reilatively neglected in legal writing. Partially this may be explained by the numerous extra-legal factors which play a part in the regulation of telecommunications and partially it is due to the initial unattractiveness of the subject. This thesis examines the legal infrastructure of space telecommunications. The need for new communications channels and the technology developed to meet this situation are outlined. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Artificial satellites in telecommunication -- Law and legislation.
Air & Space Law.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Influence of irrigation on early growth and establishment of selected forage species.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Quebec's agriculture is new becoming a major industry, but there are still notorious deficiencies in many areas which are obviously in need of improvement. Nevertheless, the economic and social situation of the farmers has been changing during the last twenty years. Subsistence has been slowly disappearing. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Pastures -- Irrigation.
Agronomy.
Forage plants.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Atmospheric kinetic energy at 500 mb as a function of zonal wave number.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An adequate portrayal of the global distribution of kinetic energy is fundamental to our understanding of the general circulation of the atmosphere. Since there are insufficient wind observations to carry out direct computations it is customary to supplement them with pressure or geopotential height data and to use space and time continuity to obtain analyzed weather maps. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Aerodynamics.
Meteorology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Genetic, physiological and environmental effects on the solids-not-fat and protein content of bovine milk.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1890, Dr. S. M. Babcock developed a practical method for the determination of butterfat in milk. From that time, fat was regarded as the major milk constituent and indeed, has controlled milk price variations in many countries, even up to the present time. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Animal Science.
Milk -- Composition.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Government control of airlines in Western Europe; a study in comparative administrative law.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Institute of Air and Space Law
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: [...] [P]art I of this study deals with a purely juristic discussion about public control of air transport. Points dealt with in part I are reviewed in part II in the light of national legislations. This approach will allow us not only to draw conclusions regarding air transport policy and control of airline operation and management, but also to analyse to what extent the existing situation is the best. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Air & Space Law.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A new approach to heavy mineral size distribution.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The size distribution of heavy minerals in water-laid sediments has previously been explained in terms of the same fluvial sorting which controlled the grain size of the light minerals. What appeared to be a sympathetic variation between the size of heavy minerals and that of the light mineral with which they were associated led to the formulation of the concept of Hydraulic Equivalence and to belief in the constancy of the hydraulic ratio. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The hexokinase system of the erythrocyte.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The work described in this thesis represents part of a large program of research on the preservation of blood. The investigation has been in continuous progress in the Department of Biochemistry under the direction of Dr. D.F. Denstedt since the outbreak of World War II in 1939. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The role of the hippocampus and septum in response inhibition.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Experimental psychologists have long concerned themselves with the initiation of behavior. There is another aspect of behavior, however, that merits equal attention and has only recently gained recognition as a major problem in psychology. This is the phenomenon of response inhibition. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Geology and geochemistry of the ore deposits, at the Vauze Mine, Noranda district, Quebec.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The ore deposits of the Noranda camp have been the subject of numerous discussions regarding ore genesis and the relationship of ore to intrusives. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Street patterns in residential areas : with special reference to Montreal.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The value and usefulness or any block or space depends largely on its degree of accessibility. Without the ability to enter, leave, or move within it freely, space is of no value at all, no matter how rich in resource. A modern city may be looked upon as a communications net made up or roads, paths, highways, rails and wires. Its prosperity and rate of growth are roughly in proportion to the capacity of its circulation system. Without an efficient system or circulation, a city would soon lose its function. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Architecture.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Natural convective heat and mass transfer from vertical plates in high temperature surroundings.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An experimental study of the rate of natural convection evaporation of water, methanol and benzene from a porous vertical plate into a quiescent environment consisting of superheated vapour of the liquids under investigation was carried out in an electrically-heated 10-in. inside diameter stainless steel cylindrical chamber. The plates had a constant width of 1.8-cm. and thickness of 0.4-cm., and their lengths ranged from 5.1 to 7.1-cm. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Cambrian (Pre-Beekmantown) sedimentation in southwestern Quebec with especial reference to three deep wells near Montreal.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The basal Paleozoic clastic units in the geologic-physiographic area known as the St. Lawrence Lowlands have been examined in the field in varying detail for the past one hundred and twenty years. However, astonishingly little detailed petrologic work has been attempted. The present study is undertaken as a preliminary qualitative evaluation of the basal Paleozoic quartzose sandstones in the St. Lawrence Lowlands of southern Quebec. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the incubation of brain sub-cellular particles under various conditions which affect the release of materials with acetylcholine-like activity.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The synthesis of acetylcholine (ACh) was achieved by Baeyer (1) as early as 1867. However, there was complete lack of interest in this compound for almost forty years. Then, in 1906, Hunt and Taveau (2) displayed its marked depressor effects on the heart and blood pressure and they further showed that these pharmacological effects could be abolished by the administration of atropine. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biochemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Woman in Puritan thought.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Calvinism invested the institution of marriage with a dignity and importance it had never before enjoyed. With its enforcement of sacerdotal celibacy and its early established tradition of regarding marriage as nothing more than a remedy for lust, the Roman Church had devalued both human sexuality and matrimony throughout the Middle Ages. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Puritans.
History.
Women.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Measurement of relative phase and intensity of radiated microwave fields of 12mm wavelengths.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis describes the development of a system for measuring phase and intensity of radiated microwave fields at 12 mm wavelengths to be used for microwave optics research. It is required that the accuracy of both the phase and the intensity measurement be within acceptable limits over the widest possible range of intensity of the signal measured and that the system be usable in both automatic and manual operation. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Electrical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Shear strength of reinforced concrete beams.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Two series of eight rectangular reinforced concrete beams without web reinforcement were tested under two symmetrical concentrated loads with the following variables: 1) percentage of longitudinal tension steel; 2) shear span to depth ratio. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Pick-up reaction from 100 Mev protons on light elements.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Stripping and pick-up reactions have for some time provided a useful tool for the study of nuclear structure. As their names imply, these are reactions that involve the transfer of one or more nucleons between incident particle and the target nucleus through some form of direct interaction mechanism. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The propagation of shocks and blast waves in a detonating gas.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The work reported in this thesis is based on the Author's work on the propagation of shocks and blast waves in an explosive medium. Part of the material in the present thesis has been published in a number of reports and papers by the Author during the period of investigation. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mechanical Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Photochemical transformations of 3- and 3,6-substituted cholesta -3,5-dienes.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Organic chemical reactions induced by ultraviolet light have been known for a long time (1), but it was not until recently that the availability or high-pressure mercury arc lamps, the chromatographic methods for separation of complex reaction mixtures, and the spectroscopic tools for routine determination of unusual structures have permitted thorough and rapid investigation of these interesting reactions (see, i.e. 2, 3, 4, 5, 6). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Acceleration of juvenility in Malus seedlings.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The fact that plant life and woody species in particular, like animals, metamorphosis in their development, is not generally appreciated. Unlike an animal, in which metamorphosis affects the whole organism, a fruit tree retains the different phases in different parts of the organism throughout its life. These phases are distinguished by both morphological and physiological differences. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Horticulture.
Growth (Plants).
Apples.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Dividing flow in an open channel.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An overall view is given of a dividing flow with mean subcritical flows in all channels. Experimental observations of reverse flows or recirculation regions, hydraulic jumps and local flows at the junction are described in detail. Photographs showing these phenomena under different flow ratios are also presented. A surface discontinuity at the junction which is not known previously is a also mentioned. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.
